title: Conditionally add billable & reimbursable columns to the reports view

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## Conditionally add billable & reimbursable columns to the reports view

Coming from https://expensify.slack.com/archives/CAS1DND4H/p1767718496897769

We would like to add support for viewing if a report's transactions are billable or reimbursable in the expense report view. We will add the following columns to the report, based on the following conditions:

- If billable is enabled on the workspace, show the Billable column in the report view. This column will show either **Yes** or **No** as its value.
- If there’s a mixture of reimbursable and non-reimbursable expenses on the report, show the Reimbursable column in the report view. This column will show either **Yes** or **No** as its value.

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @Pujan92</details>

title: [$125] `verifySignedCommits` doesn't paginate commits and can thus miss unsigned commits

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem The [`verifySignedCommits`](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/65e7b60b533741f2/.github/actions/javascript/verifySignedCommits/verifySignedCommits.ts) workflow doesn't paginate commits, so if a PR has more than 30 commits ([default value](https://docs.github.com/en/rest/commits/commits?apiVersion=2022-11-28#list-commits) for `per_page`), it doesn't properly detect unsigned commits after the 30th. ### Repro steps 1. Create a fresh branch 2. Create 30 signed commits, then an unsigned one (this assumes your git config already has signature enabled by default) ```zsh # Create 30 signed commits on a new branch for i in {1..30}; do git commit --allow-empty -m "Test commit $i" done # Create an unsigned commit git commit --no-gpg-sign --allow-empty -m "Unsigned commit test" ``` 4. Run the `verifySignedCommits` workflow 5. Notice that it passes [Example PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App-Test-Fork/pull/138) – [workflow passes](https://github.com/Expensify/App-Test-Fork/actions/runs/20764747441/job/59628267122) despite unsigned 31st commit ### Solution Use octokit's pagination functionality to get all commits on the PR.
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit

  • Upwork Job ID: 2008688139822676909

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.94-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/77911 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdosdjnnosijsnoij@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense. 4. Open expense report. 5. Click More > Split > Save. 6. Click More > Delete > Delete the report. 7. Go to self DM. 8. Open any split. 9. Click Report > Create report. 10. Click Amount. → Edit splits page opens. 11. Edit the amount and save it. 12. Click Amount field again. BUG 1: Split status is removed. Amount editor opens instead of Edit splits page. 13. Go to self DM. 14. Open the remaining split. 15. Click Report > Select the report in Step 9. 16. Click Amount. 17. Edit the amount and save it. BUG 2: "Unexpected error deleting this expense. Please try again later.The specified transaction is not one of the split transactions" error shows up. ## Expected Result: BUG 1: Split status should persist after editing the split amount. Edit splits page should open after editing the split amount. BUG 2: No error should show up after editing the second split amount. ## Actual Result: BUG 1: Split status is removed. Amount editor opens instead of Edit splits page. BUG 2: "Unexpected error deleting this expense. Please try again later.The specified transaction is not one of the split transactions" error shows up. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b396965a-10f0-46bf-a1f3-4f8c7b8a9be2 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.93-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** N/A **Issue reported by:** SRAM **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#customer-chat](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/CAS1DND4H/p1767721977637089?thread_ts=1767718496.897769&cid=CAS1DND4H) ## Action Performed: - Enable billable expenses on the workspace in Tags > More > Settings > Track billable expenses - Enable Taxes on the workspace in More features > Taxes 1. Create a report 2. Create a billable expense 3. Create a reimbursable expense with a tax value 4. Create a non-reimbursable expense ## Expected Result: _This is a new feature/improvement that was seemingly missed along the way._ 1. Add "Tax:" subtotal, displayed if at least one expense on the report has a non-zero taxAmount value. 2. Add "Billable:" subtotal, displayed if at least one expense on the report is marked as billable. 3. Rename `Out-of-pocket spend:` to `Reimbursable:`. 4. Rename `Company spend:` to `Non-reimbursable:`. Classic for reference: ## Actual Result: - Tax and billable subtotals don't show in NewDot. - reimbursable / non-reimbursable naming is different on NewDot. NewDot for reference: ## Workaround: N/A ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos In-line above. Open the Expensify Card page and tap on any expensify card 4. Tap on Deactivate 5. Tap on Assign card and all details ## Expected Result: The user sees a proper error that this can't be done with an expired trial (similar to when trying to send an expense) ## Actual Result: The front end tries to deactivate or assign the card and shows the empty page for a second until showing an unexpected error ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1e1f0355-5e3b-4085-9800-8fe834de530d https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed49218d-c98c-4cd0-97e6-fb83bae2519d [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
